definitions.text: marked by or showing unaffected simplicity and lack of guile or worldly experience
examples: a teenager's naive ignorance of life
the naive assumption that things can only get better
this naive simple creature with wide friendly eyes so eager to believe appearances

definitions.text: of or created by one without formal training; simple or naive in style
examples: primitive art such as that by Grandma Moses is often colorful and striking
lamentably unenlightened as to the laws

definitions.text: not initiated; deficient in relevant experience
examples: it seemed a bizarre ceremony to uninitiated western eyes
he took part in the experiment as a naive subject
